intro: Kutchubaea neblinensis, commonly known as the Neblin's nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the humid cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found growing along forest floors or on rocky outcrops. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
